As we begin the long journey into 2014, today Greg Theoharis shares his New Year's Day Premier League betting tips., 108=New Year's Day Premier League Odds - Odds as at 1st January 2014., 4257=Published: 1st January 2014 - Updated: 22nd January 2014, 418=As for United, how the mockers have revelled in their stuttering campaign so far. textBeforeTable: New Year's Day Premier League Odds - Odds as at 1st January 2014.   Manchester United 3 – Tottenham Hotspur 2 As for United, how the mockers have revelled in their stuttering campaign so far. We know how it works, mind. After Christmas. Win, win, win, win. Premier League wrapped up by April. Same as it ever was. So, whilst Spurs may have seen a slight upturn in fortunes since Andre Villas-Boas was ousted, we can all sleep soundly that Spurs will enter 2014 with the same propensity for self-destruction that is so characteristic of the club. By March, they’ll be screaming for Sherwood’s head at White Hart Lane and Levy will probably oblige. We keep deluding ourselves that with the turning of the year, certain aspects of our lives must change. One person’s faddy diet is another’s nicotine patch. Regardless, we all know deep down that all this is as futile as resisting a hefty transfer bid from Real Madrid. Manchester United vs Tottenham Hotspur Southampton 0 – Chelsea 2 No such problems for Chelsea. The sales are due to begin and Mourinho is certain to tread over the throng in order to get that flashy new adornment he’s had his eye on. And you know, he’s happy to pay over the odds too. How depressing. That’s Blue Monday, for you. However pleasing their early season form may have been, there’s a niggling feeling that Southampton’s will soon be dispatched to the attic with all the other Christmas decorations.
textAfterTable: Looking for more Premier League betting "advice" for this New Year's Day? Check our Premier League Betting Tips Board for all of our betting community's New Year's Day Premier League tips.     Follow Greg on Twitter: @Sofalife And read more of his work on his blog DispatchesFromAFootballSofa.com Tags:  Football, Humour, Greg Theoharis Greg Theoharis I have a sofa. I watch football on it. Then I write. Every Sunday.
